channel.title: "the system connot find the path specified" Really annoying
channel.description:
I always wanted my own RSPS so badly, i tried before like 5 months but i had a very small idea about HTML,Java,C++ but now after 5 months i learned much and took online courses and they were helpful, since yesterday im working on my own private server i had jdk1.6.0_13 and everything was going so great until i clicked run.exe on a server and a message appeared
"the system connot find the path specified"
it was weird and i knew the problem was from the environmental variables and i worked hard to fix that problem but i didnt make any progress....
what i've done: 1-i downloaded the latest version of jdk(jdk1.6.0_14) 2-i rechecked the user variables 3-i deleted the (PATH, CLASSPATH) and wrote them once again 4-i restarted the computer 5-i tried many different server sources
but nothing...
~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~
if you think that the problem is not in env. variables then take a look at my steps 1-i made a no-ip host(testestest.no-ip.biz) 2-i downloaded no-ip duc 3-my router is linksys wg200g and i did that step about port forwarding as the tut says 4-i downloaded 6 different sources(4 of them 317 and 2 of them 508)
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ please don't flame me or something but im still newb in this RSPS business.... :o
Thank you.
and here are some pictures that might help you and see if i've done any mistake
Direct link to Imageshack's gallery(4 pictures) [url=http://img521.imageshack.us/gal.php?g=85925691.png]http://img521.imageshack.us/gal.php?g=85925691.png[/url]

but though im still having much troubles, i think i can solve them with the time
but i hope i can find a guide from 0 level…

item.title: "the system connot find the path specified" Really annoying
item.dc:creator: @mastercc mastercc
item.description:
@mastercc wrote:

umm im following 3 different tut’s(GzN, RuneLocus, Mopar)and they are all the same in the environmental variables chapter, i’m really confused just want to know whats wrong

but are sure there is nothing to change with system variables?

Read full topic
item.source: "the system connot find the path specified" Really annoying

item.title: "the system connot find the path specified" Really annoying
item.dc:creator: @freeky freeky
item.description:
@freeky wrote:

dude what mod frankil said basicly go to his tut and look right click on ur run.bat and click edit then change the number that should be something like this:

“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe” *.java

Edit the 14 to ur current version of java/jdk, then everything should be set right.

Read full topic
item.source: "the system connot find the path specified" Really annoying

item.title: "the system connot find the path specified" Really annoying
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

So if you compile with my compiler it gives the error “cannot find the path specified”?

If it does, that means your environment variables are still not set right. I don’t know what exactly you’ve done wrong, but you need to start again and recheck everything. Make sure you put the right directory, make sure JDK is even installed properly.

I know you said you’ve already rechecked it but the environment variables are definitely wrong, you’ll just make to keep trying I suppose. Maybe the tutorial you’re following has a mistake in it?

Read full topic
item.source: "the system connot find the path specified" Really annoying

item.title: "the system connot find the path specified" Really annoying
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Okay Man You Can Edit The Run Manually
Heres My Tutorial
http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,372048.0.html
Hope It Helps.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 05, 2009, 03:09:58 pm[/size][hr]If Not Then Try My Sources Run.bat Code

@echo off cls cd ../build "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\java.exe" net/com/espeon/Server 43594 goto main pause

Read full topic
item.source: "the system connot find the path specified" Really annoying

item.title: "the system connot find the path specified" Really annoying
item.dc:creator: @mastercc mastercc
item.description:
@mastercc wrote:

could u explain it with details, as far as i understand your saying that the problem is in the compiler? because when i compile it says the same message.

thanks for your response.

Read full topic
item.source: "the system connot find the path specified" Really annoying

item.title: "the system connot find the path specified" Really annoying
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

Make sure you’re actually using the basic compile command, rather than one of these crappy “ultimate compilers”. It might not actually be a problem with the setup of JDK, just the technique of the more complicated compilers isn’t always up to scratch.

@echo off
javac *.java
pause

Read full topic
